title: How Trump-Putin Summit Signals Return to Imperial Thinking
summary: The two leaders are bringing some old-world approaches to bear on a 21st-century conflict.

title: Why Russia Sold Alaska to the U.S.
summary: The Trump-Putin summit will take place in a former Russian colony that the United States bought for $7.2 million in 1867. Here’s how the deal came together and why its legacy matters.

title: Trump Depicted Youth Crime in D.C. as Rampant. Here’s What the Data Shows.
summary: Concerns came to a head during the pandemic, when carjackings surged and many of those arrested were children. Carjackings and other crimes have declined considerably.

title: Congressional Democrats Move to End Trump’s Control of D.C. Police
summary: The legislation has little chance of success, given that Republicans control Congress.

title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX Most Likely Doesn’t Pay Taxes
summary: Elon Musk’s rocket company relies on federal contracts, but years of losses have most likely let it avoid paying federal income taxes, according to internal company documents.

title: The Woman to See About Your Face
summary: Melinda Farina, known as the Beauty Broker, sends Hollywood actresses and everyday women to doctors around the globe. In her world, the knives are always out.

title: How Train Riders With Disabilities Are Faring on Amtrak
summary: Passengers are facing blocked wheelchair space, getting stuck in doors and suffering other indignities 35 years after the Americans With Disabilities Act became law.

title: How Accessible Is Traveling by Amtrak?
summary: Many people with disabilities depend on Amtrak to travel across the country, but the journey can still present obstacles. Gabe Castro-Root outlines some of the challenges disabled passengers encounter while traveling.

title: Governor Hochul Pardons Laotian Immigrant to Stop His Deportation
summary: The man had been convicted of manslaughter as a teenager after he admitted to fatally shooting a man during a pool hall confrontation in Brooklyn, arguing it was self-defense.

title: St. Patrick’s Cathedral to Unveil Mural Celebrating City’s Immigrants
summary: Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan’s art commission hits a hot button. “I thought they might say, ‘We don’t want to wade in these waters’ — and the opposite happened,” the painter said.

title: No Running Water and No Electricity, but for Some Venetians, This Island Is Paradise
summary: A citizens’ group is now in charge of the island of Poveglia, where they will create a park for anyone who wants to leave Venice’s maddening crowds of tourists behind.

title: Why Does the Stock Market Keep Rising?
summary: Strong corporate earnings, mostly stable tariff rates and the expectation of interest rate cuts have eased worries of a market reckoning.

title: Why Hands-Off Investing Pays Off
summary: Put money into low-cost stock and bond funds, but don’t forget the rest of the recipe: Leave your investments alone.

title: Fed Chair Faces Scrutiny — and Bats — at Major Policy Speech in Mountain Forum
summary: A colony of bats recently took up residence at the storied Jackson Lake Lodge, where central bankers and economic policymakers will convene next week for an exclusive gathering.

title: Air Canada’s Flight Attendants Reject Call for Arbitration
summary: Their union says one of its core demands, to receive pay for groundwork, is unlikely to be introduced in arbitration. The airline began canceling flights ahead of the potential strike.

title: As Air Canada Strike Looms, Here’s What Travelers Need to Know
summary: A strike by the carrier’s flight attendants could disrupt 130,000 travelers a day, including international fliers. Here’s what to know if your flight is affected.

title: With a Shovel and a Dream, a Woman Finds a 2.3 Carat Diamond in Arkansas
summary: After three weeks, with bug bites and tattered hiking boots, Micherre Fox found the stone at Crater of Diamonds State Park.

title: The Stock Market Is Getting Scary. What You Should Do.
summary: There are troubling signs that our stock market may be overheated.

title: Boy Crisis of 2025, Meet the ‘Boy Problem’ of the 1900s
summary: It takes a village to raise a child. But some of the villagers must be men.

title: What to Know Ahead of the Trump-Putin Summit
summary: We have a primer on today’s Trump-Putin summit in Alaska.

title: A $45 Treatment Can Save a Starving Child. US Aid Cuts Have Frozen the Supply
summary: The dismantling of U.S.A.I.D. has disrupted the global supply chain that provides a therapeutic food, leaving thousands of malnourished children at risk of dying.

title: As Trump Tightens Hold on Kennedy Center, Top Theater Producer Resigns
summary: Jeffrey Finn, a Broadway producer who has overseen theater programming at the Washington venue since 2016, will leave next month.

title: Study Finds Planet Around Trappist-1 Star Shows No Signs of Life
summary: Astronomers had hoped to observe an atmosphere on one of the seven planets known to orbit Trappist-1, a red dwarf star. A new study found nothing to write home about.
